intro: Spilotantha dimorphotricha, commonly known as the two-trichome spilotantha, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with two types of trichomes, giving it its specific name. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Spilotantha dimorphotricha is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
